statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: U of the Pacific 68, Long Beach State 60
article.headline: U of the Pacific 68, Long Beach State 60
article.linkText: U of the Pacific 68, Long Beach State 60
article.story: LONG BEACH, Calif. (AP) -- David Doubley scored 15 points and Jasko Korajkic added 14 to lead Pacific to a 68-60 victory over Long Beach State Thursday night. The Tigers (9-2, 4-0 Big West Conference) have won five straight games and seven of their last eight. They improved to 5-1 on the road. Christian Maraker scored 12 points and grabbed nine rebounds for the Tigers, who have beaten Long Beach State (2-10, 0-3) in four of their last five meetings. The Tigers made 25 of 47 shots (53.2 percent) and out-rebounded the 49ers 33-26. After Johnny Gray's basket gave Pacific a 52-32 lead with 12:12 to play, Long Beach State went on an 18-5 run to cut the lead to 57-50 with 6:10 remaining. But the 49ers shooting went cold and Pacific built the lead to 63-51 with 3:24 left after a basket by Doubley. Jibril Hodges cut the Tigers' lead to 63-57 with 1:47 remaining after making three free throws, but Long Beach State scored just one more basket and Pacific converted four free throws down the stretch to secure the victory. Chris Jenkins scored 15 points and Hodges added 10 for the 49ers.
